abstract: Medical associations and other groups say that a state environmental impact statement does not adequately consider impacts from pollution and soil contamination.
snippet: Medical associations and other groups say that a state environmental impact statement does not adequately consider impacts from pollution and soil contamination.
lead_paragraph: New York's environmental study of the possible risks of high-volume hydraulic fracturing, a technique for natural gas drilling, addresses everything from the possible impact on job creation and the character of communities to damage to roads and wildlife. But a group of doctors, medical associations and environmental groups say there is one glaring omission: the possible effects on public health.

headline.main: Doctors Urge N.Y. to Weigh Health Risks of Fracking
